article_title: EU Wants to End SNCF’s Public Guarantee, Les Echos Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"L39OLY6M62GW01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2010-05-31/european-commission-wants-to-end-sncf-s-public-guarantee-les-echos-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-PdOan4m"}   The European Commission wants to end the public guarantee enjoyed by French rail company Societe Nationale des Chemins de Fer Français, Les Echos reported, citing a letter from the commission to the French government sent on Feb 11.    France replied that it had no plans to change the status of SNCF, the newspaper said. The European Commission hasn’t yet decided what to do next, Les Echos said, citing an unidentified person at the commission.    The commission also wants the end of the RATP’s Paris metro monopoly to be brought forward to 2030 from 2039, the newspaper said.
